Reviews.Title: “Seriously Dangerous”
Reviews.Author: DonbonUK
Reviews.Content: ok here we go.. I booked for 5 nights early on in the year as a business traveller. I couldn't tolerate 1 night in this hotel so I moved to a different hotel the day after. Now the problems.. I was given a single room on the ground floor. On inspection, the entire room looked old, dirty and tatty. You can clearly see parts of the wallpaper ripped. The desk, wardrobe, toilet, shower and bed were disgusting. Dust was apparent everywhere. As an asthmatic sufferer, I choked in the room and I had to give the room a wipedown. The bedlamp didn't work, there was no running Hot water in the shower! I discovered bedsheets and pillows were not changed. Strands of hair on bed covers. Marks and stains on pillows. This is enough evidence the hotel doesn't care about the wellbeing of its guests.. The worse of all... The rooms are a completely safety hazard. The smoke alarms weren't active - The alarm cover was open and you could see there were no batteries installed. The extension wires were torn out revealing internal wiring. The most alarming sight was the electrical wall sockets. One of them was cracked wide open revealingi internal wires and springs. If a child were to touch that, they could be maimed. To top it off, the walls and windows are thin so you can hear noises from other guests and you will probably be awoken by the underground tube. I told the man at the reception desk I wasn't happy with the room and I want to move out. He didn't even bother to ask why I was unhappy and shrugged his head. No refunds. I've stayed in 15 hotels around London and seriously this hotel should not even be called one. This place needs to be shut down.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it...”
Reviews.Author: TarheelFamily_001
Reviews.Content: I travel ... a lot. I'm cheap and stay at some low end places. But THIS takes the provebial CAKE. Stay here if you are desperate. Or homeless. FIRST ...my room backed up to the Tube tracks. I FELT the trains until they stopped running at 3AM the first night. Thank goodness I stayed over the wekend and they stopped running at midnight. SECOND The free breakfast? Hope you like corn flakes or muslei and toast. THIRD: Shabby doesn't begin to describe this place. I didn't see any bugs...but they were luking. This place is beyond needing a facelift...it needs a wrecking ball. Hostels in Amsterdam are nicer. I stayed in a century old hostel in Ljubljana next to the street and train tracks that was nicer. FOURTH: security? a hefty three year old could have forced open the door. OK...it IS close to the Tube and the staff isn't rude. Just indifferent. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend or enemy. Just my boss. I didn't give it a TERRIBLE rating just POOR. But I can't imagine any worse in the Western world. Maybe some place in the Gobi desert.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I can remember ever having stayed in the UK”
Reviews.Author: JABG_10
Reviews.Content: Nice people but the rooms were filthy, the toilet was broken, the bewdroom lighting didn't work proeprly, the dining facilities very dirty, the breakfast two slices of cheap white toasted bread and a cup of tea, the whole place is in need of a thorough refurbishment, there is pervading small of cigarette smoke and I would worry about getting out of the place alive if there was a fire with several mian fire doors propped open and no signs of a fire escape.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: funtravel15
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in May for our UK holiday. It was a bad experience. We were very jet lag and looking forward to a sleep. It is very hard to sleep in this place, because the train noise is very loud, and it goes most of the night. Take ear plugs. The hotel is very central and in a good location, but the hotel is very dirty and in need of repair. There is a lot of dust in the rooms, the walls are very dirty, and the bathroom is not clean. Although one staff member was helpful, some of the staff were not helpful, and at times rude. Breakfast was basic. We had to stay 7 nights in this place pre-booked, although we paid for another hotel one night to get some sleep. Most of the people in the breakfast room looked exhausted every morning, I don't think many people can sleep well here. I was counting down the days till I could leave this hotel, as unfortunately it was making me feel like I was going mad!!.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: blekh1
Reviews.Content: ok where do i start? firstly we checked out their website and all seemed ok the reviews posted did not capture how horrible this hotel actually was when we arrived they booked us in the wrong room we had to hawl our luggage up and down the stairs (3 stories) to find the correct room the stairs where a death trap most were very loose and felt like they were going to give way if u have small children i dont sugest staying - the room smelled like they hadnt been clean/dusted in a while bad for asthmatics such as me theres layers upon layers of dust on the wall sockets and windows and bed are dusty tooalso theres were stains on the walls, rippped wall paper just overall very tacky presentation- the bathrooms where covered in mould with loose and broken tiles hot water is not kept on all day but they do say it is also the wifi is very bad- the beds are more or less broken you will get a back ache in the morning if you actual manage to get some sleep with the train in the back garden literally!! which runs every 2 mins!! they stop around 12am ish and start again around 4am the beds were ichy and smelt horrible the tv is crap also recption is bad breakfast is nothing might as well not have it - this hotel is not a bargain i would never stay here even if my life depended on it!! - this is why the hotel is so cheap because they dont even have the minimal standards, there are plenty hotels around and on hogarth road we checked out the next day after trying to get our money back and stayed at one of the other hotels a cross the street - but if u dont mind not getting any sleep and just need the equivalent of a cardboard box for a shelter over u then the green court hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: bjacob75
Reviews.Content: I stayed four times at the Green Court Hotel in 2007, to-ing and fro-ing from London for job interviews. The hotel is cheap and cheerful, very basic indeed; the staff is quite kind and helpful. Breakfast is minimalist but acceptable (considering the price). The rooms are of inconsistent quality (or lack of): 1st stay: had a tiny room on the first floor. Really tiny - not even place to open the suitcase, but with an incredibly beautiful balcony on the Hogarth Road. Loved it. 2nd: big room on top floor (no lift of course). Noisy with the tube so close, but really spacious for the price 3rd: huge room on the back of the reception. Felt a bit "promiscuous" as I could hear everything that was going on there, but liked the high ceilings and the overall dimensions. 4th: tiny room like the first, but no balcony, had to stay there four days and felt pretty miserable. Luckily it was my last - and successful - interview. The decor of all the rooms is really vintage (1940?) but I do prefer a seasoned ambiance than a soulless cheapness. All of the room an ensuite bathroom and a working tv set. Cleanliness is not perfect but not awful either. All in all, it was ok - it's really cheap and you can't expect much more for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in Earl`s Court”
Reviews.Author: Lillvera
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend of mine at this hotel. staff was very friendly all time. breakfast time is from 8 till 9, but the breakfast lady is very friendly. you got a choice between cereals, toast with mermelade and coffee or tea. we stayed in a room on the ground floor and were pretty pleased for the price and the location. the hotel is situated in a nice street, although you can hear the tube. but we had no problems sleeping. anyway, if you book a hotel for little money, your expectations have to be adequate. For traveller on a small budget the hotel seems to be a good choice. i would go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Filthy bug infested hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fibb
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about staying at this filthy hotel. It is infested with bed bugs. My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a week and got bitten at least 50 times each, probably more. The bites started some kind of an allergic reaction and we looked like we had psoriasis or something worse. Had to spend a lot of money on medical bills when we got home. And there is also the risk of spreading the bugs to your home. This could require a very expensive sanitation. The hotel may seem cheap but, at least for us, it turned out to be quite expensive. Also it ruined the holiday. The hotel doesn't even reply when we have contacted them to demand a compensation. Even if the bugs don't scare you there are many other reasons not to visit this hotel: There is no hot water most of the day. The breakfast is a waste of time, a paperthin toast with jam. The hotel is very noisy with doors slamming. The bedsheets are bloodstained (because of the bugs I suppose). And the rooms are so filthy you won't believe it!!! Even the ensuite bathroom doesn't justify the price as most shared bathrooms would probably be cleaner (and have hot water all day).

Reviews.Title: “Neutral feelings after 4 nights”
Reviews.Author: PomppuJ
Reviews.Content: Cheap considering the price level in London. The quality was accordingly low - as expected, of course, so actually nothing to complain about that. The location is just excellent. I cannot recommend this hotel to persons that have problems with noise - trains go near and the walls are thin - the reception was next to our room and one could hear everything (also an alarm "pling" that sounded every time someone went out or came in to the building). But for others: a relatively cheap place to sleep with a tolerable price/quality ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Awful - dont go!! ”
Reviews.Author: stuartb1234
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay in London and had to stay in this god-awful hotel. There where 6 of us staying in 2 triple rooms. Room 1 was small and smelt of mould, thats where us guys stayed. The supposed ensuite bathroom and shower are actually outside the room and where disgusting. The toilet door did not lock so you had to hold it closed, the shower room across the hall had dirty walls and corroded pipes. The ceiling in the toilet would leak when the person in the room above used their shower. Room 2 was even worse. There where mushrooms and fungus growing on the cieling and cockroaches running around the floor. In the bathroom the tiled floor was broken and there was mould on the cieling. The girls where afraid to go to bed as they did not know what kind of wild life would be visiting them in the night. When we got up for breakfast we where told there was no room for us. This is without doubt the dirtiest and smelliest place I have ever slept and I have even slept in a field for a night without a tent. I would rather sleep rough than at this place again. I cannot convey to you just what a disgusting and run down hole this place is. Save your pennies and go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice :)”
Reviews.Author: Glompert
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for 4 nights. It's a small hotel, and the rooms (incl. bathroom) are small but nice to stay in for couple of nights. We went to town every day en we came back somewhere in the night. The reception is 24/7 open en you can always get your key. Everyday clean towels and the rooms have tv and a ventilator. The breakfast is very simple (milk with cornflakes and 2 toast and coffee or tea) but it's enough for this price. Conclusion: nice hotel! But if you don't like the subway, bad luck, the hotel is next to the subway rail (but the trains drive till 0.00 hour or something....not bad.....it didn't bother us)

Reviews.Title: “Decent price/quality ratio”
Reviews.Author: SpecialK3
Reviews.Content: I had to book a room at the last minute and this hotel suited my needs. The location can't be beat (a short walk to tube stop) and we enjoyed the coffee and toast in the morning. We had the first floor room behind the reception desk; it was decent sized, and very basic with no frills. But it seemed clean enough, especially the bathroom. We had hot water, clean towels and polite staff. It is a very dated and tattered hotel, but for the price it wasn't as bad as I was expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: velopan
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my husband for 4 days. It was a bad choice. It was terribly worn and dirty. My elbows and knees got red and itchy because of the products they used to clean the sheets. The bed was so uncomfortable I ended the trip with a backache. Our room was right behind the front desk and we could hear the front door bell everytime, night and day. And to finish, our door didn't work, and everytime we open the door it slammed (the system to avoid it was broken). One night we were leaving the room for diner and neither my husband nor me held the door (I thought he would do it and he thought the same in reverse), as we did every time, so it slammed. This guy at the front desk started shouting at us "you're waking up the guests...use your brain!". After that I decided I wouldn't ever come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In this hotel there is not a fair ratio between the price and the quality. Don't prebook, and check room before you consider checking in. Very worn down, rooms not very clean, lousy beds (springs easily felt), broken light bulbs, no hot water (boiler apparently broken AGAIN), very poor breakfast of cheapest quality. For the same price you can easily find better in the same neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Green Court on my way back through London. Had booked a single (tiny) ensuite that I saw before booking but when I checked in was given a double on the ground floor at the back. So the room was quite large and comfortable. It and the bath were clean although somewhat worn. The hotel did not seem to be full, saw no one else at breakfast, so I did not hear other guests but was lulled to sleep by the rumbling of the underground trains. Breakfast was juice, toast, cereal, and coffee or tea. The staff was friendly and helpful. This is a basic hotel with a good location - within 3 minutes walk of the Earls' Court tube station. There is no lift. It was fine for 1 nights stay. For a longer stay and for just a few pounds more per night, there are better hotels with more amenities in the area.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from London trip stayted in this hotel. This is an average hotel. Rooms are average. It is bit noisy. It seems like the walls are too thin. We could hear other people talking out side the room, in the lobby and outside. Our room was on first floor. The Good things about this hotel are - Great Location (very close approximity to Earl's Court Station) and Free Breakfast (Cereal and toast with choice of tea/coffee and juice). Staff was helpful.

HotelInfo.Name: Green Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 52 Hogarth Road | Earls Court, London SW5 0PU, England
